result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle J Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders the $350.00 cash bond on file be applied to the fine and costs.

1.  Anger Management Counseling
2.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle J Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:28 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites the plea agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Wilsnack concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as charged.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Wilsnack.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  SWD, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

Court costs
Anger Management Counseling
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court orders the $350.00 cash bond on file be applied to the court costs.

Court adjourned at 10:34 a.m.

9:12 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack - was just appointed by the PD's office.  Court will set for Status Hearing on June 16, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:12 a.m.

1:18 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will not be getting an attorney.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court will set for status hearing on April 28, at 9:00 a.m.

Corut adjourned at 1:20 p.m.

2:41 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $350.00 cash bond.  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 13, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:
